section.title: Overview
section.para: This module is a gateway for presence between SIP and XMPP.
It translates one format into another and uses xmpp, pua and presence modules to manage the transmition of presence state information.

section.title: &osips; Modules
section.para:
The following modules must be loaded before this module:
presence.
pua.
xmpp.

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para:
The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &osips; with this module loaded:
libxml.

section.title: server_address(str)
section.para: The IP address of the server.

section.title: presence_server (str)
section.para: The the address of the presence server. If set, it will be used as outbound proxy when sending PUBLISH requests.

section.title: Exported Functions
section.para: Functions exported to be used in configuration file.

Function that handles Notify messages addressed to a user from an xmpp domain. It requires filtering after method and domain in configuration file. If the function is successful, a 2xx reply must be sent.
This function can be used from REQUEST_ROUTE.

example.title: Notify2Xmpp usage

section.para: Function called when a Subscribe addressed to a user from a xmpp domain is received. It calls sending a Subscribe for winfo for the user, and the following Notify with dialog-info is translated into a subscription in xmpp. It also requires filtering in configuration file, after method, domain and event(only for presence).
It takes 2 parameters: request_uri and the value of Expires header field in received Subscribe.
This function can be used from REQUEST_ROUTE.
